title: Drawing, "Libra, Lunette for Ceiling, Sala Ottagonale, Palazzo Milzetti, Faenza", 1804–05
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and light brown wash over graphite on white laid paper
inscribed: Inscription in pen and brown ink, upper center: libra 1 autunno; in graphite, upper center: 4; in graphite: squared off at sides 1-4 and top and bottom 1-8 with light source symbol at upper right.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Winged putto with cross-bar, pair of scales, shaft and pan. Verso: caricature of standing man.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Libra, Lunette for Ceiling, Sala Ottagonale, Palazzo Milzetti, Faenza", 1804–05.
1804–05. Pen and brown ink, brush and light brown wash over graphite on white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-1184.
